Describe a famous person you would like to meet. You should say:
Who he/she is
How you know about him/her
How/where you would like to meet him/her
And explain why you would like to meet him/her.
part2.model_answer: I vividly recall a funny TV commercial for a soft drink that aired last summer. It was incredibly Catchy [朗朗上口的] because of the song they used. Although I usually find ads annoying, this one was Entertaining [有趣的], which made me watch it until the end. The Slogan [口号] was very memorable and short. It was clearly targeted at a young Audience [受众] like me. It used bright colors to grab attention. It was a very effective Promotion [促销] for the brand. I actually bought the drink later. It influenced my Consumer [消费者] choice. It was a clever piece of marketing.

part2.question:
Describe a famous sportsperson you admire. You should say:
Who this person is
What sport they play
What achievements they have made
And explain why you admire them more than other athletes.
part2.model_answer: I admit that I purchased a pair of sneakers after seeing them on social media. The Promotion [促销] showed a famous basketball player wearing them. Since the ad was so Persuasive [有说服力的], I felt I needed them, even though they were quite expensive. The Slogan [口号] promised they would improve my game. I was the perfect target Audience [受众] for this campaign. The video was visually Entertaining [有趣的] and cool. As a Consumer [消费者], I am easily influenced by trends. The ad was certainly Catchy [朗朗上口的] enough to work. I wear them every day now.

part3.question: What can today's children do to become famous?
